Issue 108 — May 5, 2016
Featured
Go Best Practices, Six Years in   opinion 
A great set of insights and tips from an experienced Go developer. This has been getting a lot of love on social media and is a must read.
Peter Bourgon
The Go 1.7 Freeze Begins Now   news 
Go 1.7 is on the way, so minor bugfixes and new features are now discouraged. “An explicit goal is to ship the first beta on time, by May 31.”
Russ Cox
Barcelona Full Stack Fest 2016: Problems of today, ideas from the future
Barcelona Full Stack Fest 2016 is a conference for curious developers looking to expand their horizons. We're offering Super Early Bird tickets at a discounted price until May 14th - exactly when the Call For Papers ends.
Full Stack Fest   sponsored 
Jet: A Template Engine Designed for Speed   code 
Based on text/template, supports template inheritance, block imports, and more. The author claims it outperforms other popular engines when templates are not pre-compiled.
Henrique Santos
Writing a Compiler in Go   tutorial 
An attempt at porting Jack Crenshaw’s famous Let’s Build a Compiler text to using Go (instead of the original Pascal).
Dan Crowley-Wilson
goserv: A Toolkit for Web Applications in Go   tools 
A toolkit that provides a layer over the net/http package to make building web applications easier.
Marcel Gotsch

Hired lets you sit back while job offers come to you. When you complete your profile, instantly apply to 3,500+ companies on the platform who will contact you with job offers, including salary and equity up-front. Try it today.
